intro: Gravesia humblotii, commonly known as the Malayan star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade. Gravesia humblotii is valued for its ornamental beauty and aromatic properties.
